## Quick Demo

Experience PyTennisScorer in action! Click "Run Code" to start scoring a tennis match:

```{python}
#| live: true

from pytennisscorer import TennisScorer, MatchType

# Create a Grand Slam singles match scorer
scorer = TennisScorer(MatchType.SINGLES_GRAND_SLAM)

# Score some points
print("Initial score:", scorer.get_score())

# Home player wins 4 points (wins first game)
for _ in range(4):
    scorer.increase_score(is_home=True)
    print(f"After point: {scorer.get_score()}")

print("\n--- Second Game ---")
# Away player wins some points
scorer.increase_score(is_home=False)
scorer.increase_score(is_home=False)
print(f"Current score: {scorer.get_score()}")
```

## Interactive Match Simulation

Try scoring your own match! Modify the code below to simulate different scenarios:

```{python}
#| live: true

# Create your own match simulation!
from pytennisscorer import TennisScorer, MatchType

# Choose your match type
match_type = MatchType.SINGLES_GRAND_SLAM  # Try other types!
scorer = TennisScorer(match_type)

# Simulate a close game
def play_points(scorer, home_points, away_points):
    """Helper to score multiple points."""
    for _ in range(home_points):
        scorer.increase_score(is_home=True)
    for _ in range(away_points):
        scorer.increase_score(is_home=False)
    return scorer.get_score()

# Play a deuce game
play_points(scorer, 3, 3)  # Both at 40
print(f"Deuce situation: {scorer.get_score()}")

scorer.increase_score(is_home=True)  # Advantage home
print(f"Advantage: {scorer.get_score()}")

scorer.increase_score(is_home=False)  # Back to deuce
print(f"Back to deuce: {scorer.get_score()}")

# Win the game
scorer.increase_score(is_home=True)  # Advantage home again
scorer.increase_score(is_home=True)  # Home wins!
print(f"Game won: {scorer.get_score()}")
```

## Getting Started

### Install from PyPI

```bash
pip install pytennisscorer
```

### Basic Usage

```{python}
#| live: true

from pytennisscorer import TennisScorer, MatchType

# Create a scorer for different match types
scorer = TennisScorer(MatchType.SINGLES_ATP_TOUR)

# Score points
scorer.increase_score(is_home=True)  # Home player scores
scorer.increase_score(is_home=False) # Away player scores

# Get the current score
print(scorer.get_score())

# Check if there's a winner
winner = scorer.get_winner()
print(f"Winner: {winner if winner else 'Match in progress'}")

# Undo last point if needed
scorer.undo()
print(f"After undo: {scorer.get_score()}")
```

## Match Types

PyTennisScorer supports 5 different match formats:

```{python}
#| live: true

from pytennisscorer import MatchType

# Display all available match types
match_types = [
    ("SINGLES_GRAND_SLAM", "Best of 5 sets, deciding point at deuce"),
    ("SINGLES_ATP_TOUR", "Best of 3 sets, deciding point"),
    ("SINGLES_ATP_FINALS", "Best of 3 sets, regular deuce"),
    ("DOUBLES_DAVIS_CUP", "Best of 5 sets, deciding point"),
    ("DOUBLES_GRAND_SLAM", "Best of 5 sets, match tiebreak in final set")
]

for match_type, description in match_types:
    print(f"‚Ä¢ {match_type}: {description}")
```
